meanings.definition: Write (something) in a hurried, careless way.
meanings.sent1: She scrawled her name on the paper quickly.
meanings.sent2: The child scrawled a message on the wall with crayons.
meanings.sent3: The cat scrawled a note to remind itself where it hid the toy.
meanings.sent4: His emotions scrawled across his face like a messy signature.
meanings.sent5: The wind scrawled patterns in the sand, creating a beautiful design.

meanings.definition: Mark or write (something) in a way that is difficult to read.
meanings.sent1: The graffiti artist scrawled his tag on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The old manuscript was scrawled with faded ink.
meanings.sent3: The spider scrawled a web so intricate, it looked like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: The memories were scrawled in her mind, blurred yet unforgettable.
meanings.sent5: The rain scrawled streaks on the window, distorting the view outside.
